requirements.summary: Create the MediaAI app shell with a collapsible left sidebar and a dynamic header title driven by the active tab (Image Maker, Video Studio, Voice Over).
acceptanceCriteria: Sidebar renders three navigation items (Image Maker, Video Studio, Voice Over) and highlights the active item.
Sidebar can be toggled between expanded and collapsed states; when collapsed, labels are hidden and icons remain visible.
Header title updates correctly when switching tabs.
All user-facing text is in English.

file_operations.description: Implement the top-level MediaAI shell layout: collapsible left sidebar, top header with dynamic title text for active tab, and tab content switching for Image Maker / Video Studio / Voice Over. Ensure labels match the provided snippet and active nav item is highlighted.
Create a reusable shell component encapsulating sidebar + header + main content area, including the collapse toggle behavior and activeTab state contract used by App.
Add a small sidebar nav item component that supports icon-only collapsed rendering, active styling, and English labels for the three required tabs.

requirements.summary: Build the Image Maker tab UI with prompt input, Enhance/Create actions, and a responsive selectable image gallery that opens a full-screen preview/editor.
acceptanceCriteria: Prompt input, Enhance button, and Create button are present and disabled appropriately when prompt is empty or a request is in progress.
A loading indicator is shown on Create/Apply actions when loading=true (as in the snippet).
Generated images appear as square cards in a responsive grid (1/2/3 columns across breakpoints).
Clicking an image opens the full-screen preview/editor and sets it as the selected image.

file_operations.description: Implement the Image Maker tab UI: prompt input (with the specified placeholder), Enhance and Create actions wired to local stubbed AI functions, loading state handling, and a responsive gallery grid of square cards that sets selectedImage on click.
Create the responsive image gallery grid component with 1/2/3 column behavior at breakpoints, square card styling, and click-to-select behavior.
Wire the ImageMakerView into the shell so selecting the Image Maker tab renders this view and the header title matches the required wording.

requirements.summary: Implement a full-screen image preview & AI editor overlay with edit prompt, suggestion chips (max 3), and Apply action that adds the edited image back into the gallery and updates selection.
acceptanceCriteria: Full-screen modal/overlay opens when selectedImage is set and closes via Cancel/Close Preview actions.
The editor panel contains a textarea for edit instructions and an Apply action that is disabled when edit text is empty or loading=true.
Clicking Get Edit Suggestions shows up to 3 short suggestion chips; clicking a chip populates the edit prompt textarea.
Applying an edit results in a new image being prepended to the gallery and becomes the currently selected image (UI behavior).

file_operations.description: Build the full-screen overlay UI for selectedImage: large image display, edit textarea, Get Edit Suggestions action, up-to-3 suggestion chips with one-click insertion, Apply AI Changes action, and Close/Cancel controls.
Integrate ImageEditorOverlay: manage selectedImage, editPrompt, aiSuggestions, and loading; ensure Apply prepends the new image to the gallery and updates selectedImage as specified.
Add a small component to render up to three suggestion chips and handle chip click to populate the edit prompt (including stripping numeric prefixes as per the snippet behavior).

requirements.summary: Implement the Voice Over tab UI with topic input, stubbed script generation, editable script textarea, voice dropdown options, and a non-functional Preview Audio button.
acceptanceCriteria: User can enter a topic and click Generate Script to populate the script textarea (using a stubbed generator per REQ-6).
User can manually edit the generated script in the textarea.
Voice dropdown renders the three options exactly as shown.
Preview Audio button is present and clearly indicated as a non-functional preview (no external API calls).

file_operations.description: Implement the Voice Over tab UI: topic input (with specified placeholder), ✨ Generate Script action using local stub logic, editable script textarea (with specified placeholder), voice selection dropdown with the three exact options, and a UI-only Preview Audio button with clear non-functional indication.
Wire the VoiceOverView into the shell so selecting the Voice Over tab renders this view and the header title matches the required wording.

requirements.summary: Implement the Video Studio tab as a presentational screen matching the snippet with placeholder button actions and no real video generation.
acceptanceCriteria: Video Studio tab shows the title, description, and the two buttons.
Buttons are wired to placeholder actions (e.g., toast/alert or no-op) but do not call any external services.
No actual video file generation is implemented.

file_operations.description: Create the Video Studio presentational screen with the required title, description, icon area, and Add Photos / Generate Video buttons wired to safe placeholder actions (no external calls).
Wire the VideoStudioView into the shell so selecting the Video Studio tab renders this view and the header title matches the required wording.

requirements.summary: Remove/avoid external AI network calls and replace them with local stub implementations for prompt enhancement, script generation, edit suggestions, image creation, and image editing while preserving prompt strings in code.
acceptanceCriteria: No frontend code performs fetch() (or equivalent) requests to generativelanguage.googleapis.com (or any other external AI endpoints).
Enhance Prompt produces a longer, more detailed prompt string derived from the input (deterministic or pseudo-random stub is acceptable).
Generate Script produces a ~50–70 word English script based on the topic (stubbed).
Get Edit Suggestions returns exactly 3 short English suggestions (stubbed).
Create produces a new image result suitable for the gallery (e.g., generated placeholder image data URL) and clears the prompt input afterward.
Apply AI Changes produces a new image result and sets it as selected.

file_operations.description: Implement local stub functions for: enhancePrompt, generateImage, getEditSuggestions (exactly 3), applyImageEdit, and generateVoiceScript (~50–70 English words). Preserve the referenced future-wiring prompt strings/constants in this module, but do not perform any network requests.
Add helper(s) to generate deterministic placeholder image data URLs (e.g., via Canvas gradients/text) for gallery results used by the stubbed image creation/editing flows.
Replace any AI/network logic with calls into frontend/src/lib/aiStubs.ts; ensure loading states, prompt clearing after Create, and edited image insertion behaviors match the acceptance criteria.
Wire Get Edit Suggestions and Apply AI Changes to the stubbed implementations in frontend/src/lib/aiStubs.ts, maintaining required loading/disabled states and selection updates.
Use the stubbed voice script generator from frontend/src/lib/aiStubs.ts for ✨ Generate Script and ensure no external calls are made.

requirements.summary: Apply a consistent dark, cinematic theme across shell, tabs, and overlays with coherent spacing, typography, borders, and interactive states.
acceptanceCriteria: App has a consistent dark/cinematic look across sidebar, header, tab bodies, and modal overlay.
Buttons/inputs have clear hover and focus states and meet basic readability/contrast expectations.
No user-facing text uses placeholder lorem ipsum; all labels remain English and aligned with the provided snippet.

file_operations.description: Add global styling consistent with the dark/cinematic direction (near-black surfaces, slate text, electric accent focus rings) and ensure base elements support consistent typography, spacing, and focus visibility across the app.
Adjust/extend Tailwind theme tokens as needed to support the cinematic palette and consistent component styling across sidebar/header/modals (without introducing new global stylesheet entry points).

Apply consistent layout styling for sidebar, header, and content surfaces (dark slate/near-black), including hover/focus states for navigation items and the collapse toggle to match the requested UI direction.
Ensure the full-screen overlay uses a cohesive dark modal treatment with readable typography, consistent padding/borders, and clear hover/focus states for actions and chips.
